meanings.definition: The state of appearing worn or exhausted, especially due to fatigue or worry.
meanings.sent1: Her haggardness was evident in the dark circles under her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The haggardness of the old man's face showed years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: Despite her haggardness, she still managed to crack a smile.
meanings.sent4: The haggardness of the landscape mirrored his inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The haggardness of his voice revealed the long hours he had worked.

meanings.definition: The quality of being gaunt or emaciated in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The haggardness of the stray dog made everyone feel sorry for it.
meanings.sent2: His haggardness was a result of not eating properly for days.
meanings.sent3: The haggardness of the scarecrow made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The haggardness of the tree branches in winter gave a spooky vibe.
meanings.sent5: The haggardness of the old house made it look haunted.
